channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Smarter AI is supercharging battery innovation
item.description: The global race for better batteries has never been more intense. Electric vehicles, drones, and next-generation aircraft all depend on high-performan...

item.title: Quiet firing is spreading, but there are business risks to tactics to push workers out
item.description: As more companies demand employees spend more days in their workplaces each week, some critics claim that tightening return to office (RTO) rules in p...

item.title: Why Leaders Should Rethink the ‘Live Each Day Like It’s Your Last’ Mindset
item.description: Leaders are increasingly filtering through a lens of urgency. If they’re not careful, it might be their undoing.

item.title: The CEO’s Playbook for Team Feedback That Delivers Results
item.description: Leaders can create workplace cultures that welcome feedback and facilitate growth.

item.title: AI passed the aesthetic Turing Test, raising big questions for art
item.description: Pick up an August 2025 issue of Vogue , and you’ll come across an advertisement for the brand Guess featuring a stunning model . Yet tucked away in sm...

item.title: The Shawn Kemp sentence: He says his truck and cellphone were stolen and he returned fire at the thieves. Nobody was hurt but he’s under electronic home monitoring
item.description: The former NBA star looked at the ceiling and blew a huff of air when he heard his sentence, which also includes 240 hours of community service.

item.title: The Federal Reserve could start resembling the Supreme Court
item.description: Fed governors typically step down before their terms expire, but they may stay on until a president from their political party is in the White House.

item.title: The last ‘ace’: World War II fighter pilot Donald McPherson, who shot down 5 enemy planes, dies at 103
item.description: McPherson was listed as the conflict's last living U.S. ace by both the American Fighter Aces Association and the Fagen Fighters WWII Museum.

item.title: U.S. Open 2025: Schedule for singles competition, how to watch Coco Gauff and Jannik Sinner matches livestreaming on a TV or phone
item.description: It’s time to bust out your best tennis skirts and collared shirts: The 2025 U.S. Open is upon us, with singles play beginning Sunday, August 24. The U...

item.title: 5 Signs Your Leadership Style Is Holding You Back From Scaling, and How to Fix It
item.description: Are you the bottleneck? Founders often unintentionally stand in the way of their company’s growth.

item.title: You Are Your Greatest Asset in Business. Here’s How to Sell to Buyers, Not Just Investors
item.description: If investors overlook you, let customers overbook you. That’s resilience.

item.title: It’s so hot in the western U.S. that some people are ‘wobbling’ and collapsing to the ground as they walk outside
item.description: About 1.2 million people were under extreme heat risk, meaning temperatures were expected to stay dangerously high with no relief overnight.

item.title: ‘A bit of a shock’: Even community colleges, largely nonpartisan commuter schools, are feeling the Trump education crackdown
item.description: A professor in Colorado said that at his school, you don't typically see "the kind of unrest and polarization that you see at other campuses.”

item.title: SpaceX Eyes Starship Reusability Milestones in Rocket’s Tenth Flight Test
item.description: Elon Musk hopes to use the rocket to put Starlink satellites into orbit, a major source of revenue for the company.

item.title: How ‘good cause’ eviction laws aim to protect renters from eviction
item.description: Matt Losak got interested in evictions when he was nearly subject to one. He was working for a union, which required frequent travel. One month he acc...
